t: Isaiah 3
Judgment on Judah and Jerusalem
For*pn behold, the Lord, the Lord*s of hosts, Takes*ld away from Jerusalem and from Judah The*ld stock and the store, The*ld whole supply of bread and the whole supply of water;
The*ld mighty man and the man of war, The*ld judge and the prophet, And*ld the diviner and the elder;
The*ld captain of fifty and the honorable man, The*ld counselor and the skillful artisan, And*ld the expert enchanter.
“I*ld will give children to*i be*i their princes, And*ld babes shall rule over them.
The*ld people will be oppressed, Every*ld one by another and every one by his neighbor; The*ld child will be insolent toward the elder, And*ld the base toward the honorable.”
When*ln a man takes hold of his brother In*ld the house of his father, saying,*i “You*ld have clothing; You*ld be our ruler, And*ld let*i these ruins be*i under your power,”
In*ld that day he will protest, saying, “I*ld cannot cure your*i ills, For*ld in my house is*i neither food nor clothing; Do*ld not make me a ruler of the people.”
For*ln Jerusalem stumbled, And*ld Judah is fallen, Because*ld their tongue and their doings Are*ild against the Lord,*s To*ld provoke the eyes of His glory.
The*ld look on their countenance witnesses against them, And*ld they declare their sin as Sodom; They*ld do not hide it.*i Woe*ld to their soul! For*ld they have brought evil upon themselves.
“Say*ln to the righteous that it*i shall*i be*i well with*i them,*i For*ld they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
Woe*ld to the wicked! It*i shall*i be*i ill with*i him,*i For*ld the reward of his hands shall be given him.
As*ild for*i My people, children are*i their oppressors, And*ld women rule over them. O*ld My people! Those who lead you cause you*i to err, And*ld destroy the way of your paths.”
Oppression and Luxury Condemned
The*pn Lord*s stands up to plead, And*ld stands to judge the people.
The*ld Lord*s will enter into judgment With*ld the elders of His people And*ld His princes: “For*ld you have eaten up the vineyard; The*ld plunder of the poor is*i in your houses.
What*ld do you mean by crushing My people And*ld grinding the faces of the poor?” Says*ld the Lord God*s of hosts.

Moreover*p the Lord*s says: “Because*pn the daughters of Zion are haughty, And*ld walk with outstretched necks And*ld wanton eyes, Walking*ld and mincing as*i they go, Making*ld a jingling with their feet,
Therefore*ld the Lord will strike with a scab The*ld crown of the head of the daughters of Zion, And*ld the Lord*s will uncover their secret parts.”
In*ln that day the Lord will take away the finery: The*ld jingling anklets, the scarves, and the crescents;
The*ld pendants, the bracelets, and the veils;
The*ld headdresses, the leg ornaments, and the headbands; The*ld perfume boxes, the charms,
and*ld the rings; The*ld nose jewels,
the*ld festal apparel, and the mantles; The*ld outer garments, the purses,
and*ld the mirrors; The*ld fine linen, the turbans, and the robes.

And*p so it shall be: Instead*pn of a sweet smell there will be a stench; Instead*ld of a sash, a rope; Instead*ld of well-set hair, baldness; Instead*ld of a rich robe, a girding of sackcloth; And*ld branding instead of beauty.
Your*ld men shall fall by the sword, And*ld your mighty in the war.
Her*ln gates shall lament and mourn, And*ld she being*i desolate shall sit on the ground.
